info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 06 at 8:51AM EST until February 07 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River Near Fletcher affecting Buncombe and Henderson Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...French Broad River Near Fletcher. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Action/Advisory Stage. The French Broad River has exceeded bankfull at the gauge site. Isolated farmland flooding continues across the French Broad River Valley from Etowah downstream to Avery Creek upstream of the gauge site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:16 AM EST Sunday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.2 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement should be issued this evening before 900 PM EST.
